6.8. Poisson type solutions of Riccati’s equation with Dirichlet data
Let Ω be a smooth, bounded planar domain and let the origin O be a point
of ∂Ω. Consider the equation
∆u + α u2
x + β u2
y = 0
in
Ω,
where α and β are smooth positive functions given on Ω. We assume that
the solution u satisfies u = 0 on ∂Ω\{O}.
Problem. Prove that either u = 0 on ∂Ω, or u has a logarithmic singularity
at O and depends upon an arbitrary constant.
A formal asymptotic expansion of u near O can be found in [92], also
for more general equations.
